summary: The Hawaii Native Species Conservation and Recovery Act of 2025 establishes a competitive grant program administered by the Secretary of the Interior to fund projects focused on conserving and recovering native plant, fungi, and animal species in Hawaii. The program aims to address threats such as invasive species, climate change, and habitat loss. Grants will be awarded to eligible entities, including state and local governments, Native Hawaiian organizations, nonprofits, businesses, and institutions of higher education. The bill mandates annual reports to Congress and authorizes $30 million annually for the program, with provisions for technical assistance and consultation with Native Hawaiian organizations.
